distorCont.rpOrgName: Data-Intensive Landscape Limnology Lab, Department of Fisheries and Wildlife, Michigan State University

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Kendra Cheruvelil, Michigan State University, Co-Principal Investigator
Patricia Soranno, Michigan State University, Principal Investigator
Patricia Soranno, Michigan State University, Principal Investigator

cntAddress.delPoint: 334 Natural Resources Bldg., 480 Wilson Rd., East Lansing, MI, 48824

dataIdInfo.idAbs: LAGOS-NE contains data for all 51,102 lakes and reservoirs > 4 ha in the 17 U.S. state study area and along their borders (1,800,000 sq. km.), referred to as the census lake population. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database complements three data modules called LAGOS-NE-LOCUS, LAGOS-NE-GEO, and LAGOS-NE-LIMNO. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database contains geospatial data layers describing the boundaries, spatial classifications, and freshwater features used to compile the LAGOS-NE database. The LAGOS-NE All Lakes (4ha) layer is a subset derivative of the National Hydrography Dataset NHDWaterbody dataset that contains a polygon for each lake larger than a 4-hectare cutoff in the LAGOS-NE study region.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: We have created a database for lakes in the northeastern-most 17 U.S. states called LAGOS-NE (LAke multi-scaled GeOSpatial and temporal database). We had three related motivations for developing this database: (1) to develop the basic understanding of lake nutrients and productivity at sub-continental scales, with a focus on studying cross-scale interactions and their drivers using water quality data on thousands of lakes collected overacross the last several decades (see Soranno et al. 2014 and Soranno et al. 2015 for details); (2) to build the capacity to apply this scientific understanding to environmental management and policy of freshwaters; and, (3) to foster broad-scale research by designing an open-science database infrastructure that includes detailed characterization of lake ecological context that is extensible for future uses and by making the data and methods publicly accessible. The LAGOS-NE GIS Database is provided for the purposes of displaying LAGOS-NE data, understanding their geospatial relationships, and supporting further spatial analyses with these data. The LAGOS-NE All Lakes (4ha) layer identifies the location and shape of all the 4 ha lakes in the LAGOS-NE study region. It includes every lake that has LAGOS-GEO data provided. The purpose of this layer is not to definitively document or measure the total number of lakes in the study region.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: METHODS PUBLICATION: Soranno, Patricia A., Edward G. Bissell, Kendra S. Cheruvelil, Samuel T. Christel, Sarah M. Collins, C. Emi Fergus, Christopher T. Filstrup et al. "Building a multi-scaled geospatial temporal ecology database from disparate data sources: fostering open science and data reuse." GigaScience 4, no. 1 (2015): 28. ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS: Support for creating LAGOS-NE was provided by the National Science Foundation MacroSystems Biology Program in the Emerging Frontiers Division of the Biological Sciences Directorate (EF-1065786and EF-1638679 to MSU, EF-1065649 to ISU, and EF-1065818 and EF-1638554 to UW) and the USDA National Institute of Food and Agriculture, Hatch project 176820 to PAS. Author KEW thanks the STRIVE Programme (2011-W-FS-7) from the Environmental Protection Agency, Ireland. Author SMC also thanks the NSF Division of Biological Infrastructure (1401954). Further credits for other modules LAGOS-NE beyond the GIS Database are detailed in Soranno et al. 2017.

Consts.useLimit: The LAGOS-NE database should be acknowledged in products derived from these data. The citation may include the DOI of the database and/or the accompanying manuscript.

report.measDesc: No formal logical tests were conducted.
No formal completeness tests were conducted.

prcStep.stepDesc: We downloaded the NHD data staged by subregion for 65 subregions with the following codes or code ranges: 0101-0110, 0202-0205, 0207, 0401-0415, 0501-0504, 0506, 0508-0509, 0512, 0514, 0701-0714, 0801-0802, 0902-0903, 1017, 1023-2024, 1028-1030, 1101, 1107. We calculated the Lake Connection value using the Lake Connectivity tool in the LAGOS GIS Toolbox. We filtered the features to keep only the permanent lakes and reservoirs over 1 hectare in size using the following query: AreaSqKm">=0.01 AND ("FCode"=39000 OR "FCode"=39004 OR "FCode"=39009 OR "FCode"=39010 OR "FCode"=39011 OR "FCode"=39012 OR "FCode"=43600 OR "FCode"=43613 OR "FCode"=43615 OR "FCode"=43617 OR "FCode"=43618 OR "FCode"=43619 OR "FCode"=43621 OR ("FCode"=43601AND"AreaSqKm">=0.1)). We merged the features from all subregions, deleting duplicates of the same Permanent_Identifier by keeping the lake with the most recent FDate. We also removed duplicates with differing Permanent_Identifiers that overlapped >90% by keeping the lake with the latest FDate. The dataset was re-projected and the Lake_Area_Ha value was calculated after re-projection. The lake features were spatially joined to the WBD dataset to calculate the hydrologic unit, EDU, county, and state that contained them (either entirely, or if the lake was on the border, the region that contained the lake's centroid). The "OUT_OF_*" identifier was assigned with the lake fell outside all regions. Some lakes were manually assigned to a state at the end of this process. The lagoslakeid identifier was generated. Finally, the filter >= 4 hectares was applied to create this layer.

dataSource.srcDesc: The location, shape, and attributes of the lake features.

citRespParty.rpOrgName: U.S. Geological Survey in cooperation with U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, USDA Forest Service, and other Federal, State and local partners

dataSource.srcDesc: The identification of which hydrologic unit each lake is contained in.

cntAddress.delPoint: 501 W. Felix Street, Bldg. 23, Fort Worth, Texas, 76115

enttyp.enttypd: Permanent lakes and reservoirs 4 hectares or larger

attr.attrdef: The name of the 6-digit hydrologic unit that the lake is in. Uses the hydrologic unit that entirely contains the lake or the hydrologic unit containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses unit boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Text

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier. The first eight digits are the WBD_HUC8. The next six digits are randomly assigned, sequential numbers that are unique within a HUC8, length 14.

attrdomv.udom: 14-character string comprised of 8-digit HUC followed by numeric digits randomly generated upon creation

attr.attrdef: The LAGOS-NE Zone ID of the 8-digit hydrologic unit that the lake is in. Uses the hydrologic unit that entirely contains the lake or the hydrologic unit containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses unit boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Character string contains spatial classification prefix followed by sequentially generated numeric value

attr.attrdef: A class assigned based on the presence of upstream surface hydrological connections to the lake, and the presence of stream-connected upstream lakes (defined as a water body >= 10 ha).

edom.edomvd: Lakes with no inflow or outflow permanent streams.
Lakes connected to surface water through inflowing permanent streams, with no upstream lakes (>=10 ha), and may or may not have outflowing permanent streams.
Lakes connected to surface water through inflowing permanent streams, with at least one upstream lake (>=10 ha), and may or may not have outflowing permanent streams.
Lakes at the headwater of a stream network (i.e. no inflowing permanent streams, but by definition, they DO have at least one outflowing permanent stream).

attr.attrdef: The name of the county the lake is in. Uses the county that entirely contains the lake or the county containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses county boundaries.

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Information for Counties and Equivalent Entities

attr.attrdef: The LAGOS-NE Zone ID of the 6-digit hydrologic unit that the lake is in. Uses the hydrologic unit that entirely contains the lake or the hydrologic unit containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses unit boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Character string contains spatial classification prefix followed by sequentially generated numeric value

attr.attrdef: Date of last feature modification.

attrdomv.udom: Date

attr.attrdef: The vertical distance from a given datum. Elevation is only set on features where a dam controls the elevation of the water and references the NGVD 1929 datum.

The code of the 6-digit hydrologic unit that the lake is in. Uses the hydrologic unit that entirely contains the lake or the hydrologic unit containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses unit boundaries.
Unique identifier for a lake in the LAGOS-NE database.

attrdomv.udom: Auto-assigned unique integer

attr.attrdef: The name of the county the lake is in. Uses the county that entirely contains the lake or the county containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses county boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Character string contains spatial classification prefix followed by sequentially generated numeric value

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the 4-digit hydrologic unit that the lake is in. Uses the hydrologic unit that entirely contains the lake or the hydrologic unit containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses unit boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Text

attr.attrdef: The two-character abbreviation of the state the lake is in. Uses the state that entirely contains the lake or the state containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses state boundaries.

attr.attrdef: The name of the EDU the lake is in. Uses the EDU that entirely contains the lake or the EDU containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses EDU boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Character string contains spatial classification prefix followed by sequentially generated numeric value

attr.attrdef: Integer value that uniquely identifies the occurrence of each feature in the NHD.

attrdomv.udom: Original national database key assigned by USGS when data was loaded.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.

attrdomv.udom: Coordinates defining the features.

attr.attrdef: The name of the state the lake is in. Uses the state that entirely contains the lake or the state containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses state boundaries.

attr.attrdef: The name of the EDU the lake is in. Uses the EDU that entirely contains the lake or the EDU containing the centroid of the lake if the lake crosses EDU boundaries.
